actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on October 30, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
Mr. Roy asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Thursday, October 26, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 12 p.m. on Monday, October 30, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. D'Esposito notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Balint notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4394.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 210
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 199

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Castor (FL) moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gross as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 4394.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Rosendale amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 192
On agreeing to the Rosendale amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 76
On agreeing to the Rosendale amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 100
On agreeing to the Pfluger amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 164
On agreeing to the Pfluger amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 160
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 166

actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 6(h) of rule XVIII, the Committee of the Whole resumed its sitting.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Norman amendment (A034) Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 207

actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to clause 6(h) of rule XVIII, the votes of the Delegates and Resident Commissioners were decisive on the previous vote and a separate vote in the House was required.
Pursuant to clause 6(h) of rule XVIII, the Committee rose.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 208
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 207
On agreeing to the Luna amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 120

actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 60, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Rosendale demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 60.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Rosendale,  numbered 60 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds from being used to implement any of the Administration's climate change executive orders.

At the conclusion of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 59, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Rosendale demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 59.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Rosendale,  numbered 59 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce funds appropriated to the US Army Corp of Engineers--Civil by $620,000,000 to match FY22 levels.

At the conclusion of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 58, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Fleischmann demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Rosendale amendment No. 58.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Rosendale,  numbered 58 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2024 by $1,553,000,000 to match FY22 levels.

At the conclusion of debate on the Pfluger amendment No. 57, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Pfluger amendment No. 57.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Pfluger,  numbered 57 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce the salary of Andrew Light, Assistant Secretary of Energy for International Affairs, to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Pfluger amendment No. 56, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Pfluger amendment No. 56.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Pfluger,  numbered 56 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce the salary of Gene Rodrigues, Assistant Secretary for Electricity for the Office of Electricity, to $1.
On agreeing to the Palmer amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Palmer amendment No. 54.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Palmer,  numbered 54 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit the Department of Energy from using funds to implement, administer, or enforce its rule regarding Room Air Conditioners.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 53.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 53 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds to be used to finalize the rule entitled Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Automatic Commercial Ice Makers."
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 52.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 52 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for enforcing any COVID-19 mask mandates.

At the conclusion of debate on the Norman amendment No. 51, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the nays had prevailed. Mr. James demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 51.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 51 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce the salary of Jennifer M. Granholm, Secretary of the Department of Energy, to $1.

At the conclusion of debate on the Norman amendment No. 50, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 50.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 50 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funding for the American Climate Corps.
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 49.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 49 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for the consideration of the Social Cost of Greenhouse Gases (SC-GHG) in the development and implementation of budgets, federal procurement processes, or environmental reviews.
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 48.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 48 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funding for the Interagency Working Group on the Social Cost of Greenhouse Gases.

At the conclusion of debate on the Norman amendment No. 47, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 47.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 47 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for Department of Energy Office of Science's Office of Scientific Workforce Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (SW-DEI).
On agreeing to the Norman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Norman amendment No. 46.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Norman,  numbered 46 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funding for the rule titled "Energy Conservation Program: Energy Conservation Standards for Manufactured Housing"
On agreeing to the McCormick amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the McCormick amendment No. 45.

An amendment, offered by Mr. McCormick,  numbered 45 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds provided by this Act from closing campgrounds operated by the Army Corps of Engineers that are located at Lake Sidney Lanier, Georgia.
On agreeing to the Luna amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Luna amendment No. 44.

An amendment, offered by Mrs. Luna,  numbered 44 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds to implement or enforce Corps of Engineers memo CERE-AP, issued by the South Atlantic division on July 9, 1996, relating to "Approval of Perpetual Beach Storm Damage Reduction Easement as a Standard Estate" which has halted beach renourishment projects across the country, including the aftermath of natural disasters.

At the conclusion of debate on the Luna amendment No. 43, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kaptur demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Luna amendment No. 43.
An amendment, offered by Mrs. Luna,  numbered 43 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to reduce the salary of Michael Connor, Assistant Secretary of the Army for Civil Works, to $1.
On agreeing to the Lamborn amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Lamborn amendment No. 42.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Lamborn,  numbered 42 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds from this act from granting access of citizens from countries on the sensitive countries list to non-public areas of National Security Laboratories.
On agreeing to the Jackson (TX) amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 41.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Jackson (TX),  numbered 41 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit NNSA from halting construction on the HE Synthesis, Formulation, and Production facility at the Pantex Plant.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 176

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on agreeing to the amendments to H.R. 4394, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 40.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 40 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit the use of funds to finalize, implement, or enforce rulemaking pertaining to energy conservation standards for consumer water heaters.

At the conclusion of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 39, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Fleischmann demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 39.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 39 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit any funding from going towards the SuperTruck III program at DOE.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 38.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 38 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for DOE's implementation of their proposed Industrial Decarbonization Roadmap.

At the conclusion of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 37, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Garamendi demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 37.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Garamendi,  numbered 37 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funds for the W87-1 modification program to enable additional analysis of the underlying program justifications, planning and budget.

At the conclusion of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 36, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Garamendi demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 756, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Garamendi amendment No. 36.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Garamendi,  numbered 36 printed in Part B of House Report 118-242 to prohibit funding for plutonium pit production at the Savannah River Plutonium Processing Facility.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4394 â€” "Making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The House resumed with one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Ms. Greene (GA) notified the House of her intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Titus to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend John Matthews, Grace Lutheran Church, Apple Valley, Minnesota.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
